dataList.content: <color=#d4e1e8>Ah, and so...</color>
<color=#d4e1e8>Am I still a 'nothing'?</color>
As the intense golden glow fades, the space begins to twist and morph.
Did the Golden Bough have the power do to this? I don't think we've even entered the fathoms of ego yet... Was it capable of warping the real world?
Excitement or questions over matters related to the Golden Boughs have little meaning.
To you, and to Faust... All of us would be the very first witnesses to what is happening before our eyes.
It would be statistically sound to assume that we will continue to witness previously unseen events in the future.
I suppose you're right... I mean, look at that...
Unable to properly articulate her words any further, Ishmael pointed a finger instead.
Even the dead... are coming back...
Bodies that have been devoid of life for a while begin to rise.
Their organs or body parts were severely damaged; this could only be described as 'resurrection'.
Huh, I've seen some stuff, but bringing people back from the dead... sounds too implausible. Even K Corp's HP ampules couldn't do this much, right?
It's unlikely that there was absolutely no technology or Singularity capable of complete revival at some point.
However, if such technology did exist... I, for one, haven't heard of it once even during war.
That can only mean... it's not a kind of technology allowed to prosper in the City. ...If I had to guess, the Head might...
Indeed. It may well be an act of taboo as established by the Head.
It's completely different from Limbus Company's case, where we can experience revival by synchronizing with Dante.
It's different, and wrong.
Theirs is not a complete restoration, unlike our case. They're merely...
Animated. That is all. They appear to lack consciousness and reason.
Seems that way... In other words, I guess it would only count as a taboo if both the mind and body are recovered.
